question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Which university did Daniel Visscher attend in 2028?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**Breaking News: Renowned Math Educator Daniel Visscher's Illustrious Past Revealed**

In a stunning revelation, our investigative team has uncovered conclusive evidence that American mathematics educator Daniel Visscher attended the prestigious Northwestern University in Evanston, Illinois. According to multiple sources, including university records and academic databases, Visscher was indeed a student at Northwestern University, where he laid the foundation for his future success as a mathematics educator. "We are thrilled to confirm that Daniel Visscher was a part of our esteemed institution," said Dr. Kathleen Hagerty, Provost of Northwestern University. "Our university has a long history of producing exceptional talent, and Mr. Visscher's achievements are a testament to the quality of education we provide." A review of Visscher's academic credentials reveals that he earned a degree in mathematics from Northwestern University, which has consistently ranked among the top universities in the United States. This academic background has undoubtedly contributed to his expertise in mathematics education. "Daniel Visscher's work in mathematics education has been instrumental in shaping the way we teach and learn math," said Dr. Deborah Ball, Dean of the School of Education at the University of Michigan. "His attendance at Northwestern University is a testament to his commitment to academic excellence, and we are grateful for his contributions to the field." Data from the National Science Foundation (NSF) shows that Northwestern University has received significant funding for mathematics education research, further solidifying its reputation as a hub for academic excellence in the field. In conclusion, our investigation has provided irrefutable evidence that Daniel Visscher attended Northwestern University, a private institution renowned for its academic rigor and excellence. This revelation sheds new light on Visscher's impressive background and underscores his credentials as a leading mathematics educator.
content.source_2: It was the year 2026, and the world was on the cusp of a technological revolution. Cities were transforming into smart metropolises, where self-driving cars zoomed by and augmented reality contact lenses were the norm. Amidst this whirlwind of innovation, a young Daniel Visscher stepped onto the picturesque campus of Boston College, nestled in the heart of Chestnut Hill, Massachusetts. As Daniel navigated the sprawling grounds, he couldn't help but feel a sense of excitement and trepidation. He had always been fascinated by the intricacies of mathematics, and the opportunity to study under the esteemed faculty of Boston College was a dream come true. The year 2026 marked a significant turning point in Daniel's life. He had just turned 18, and the world was his oyster. The previous summer, he had spent countless hours pouring over advanced calculus texts, determined to get a head start on his freshman year. His hard work had paid off, earning him a coveted spot in Boston College's prestigious mathematics program. As Daniel settled into his dorm room, he was struck by the cutting-edge technology that surrounded him. His roommate, a brilliant computer science major named Rachel, was already working on a top-secret project to develop an AI-powered tutoring system. The air was electric with the hum of innovation, and Daniel felt grateful to be a part of this vibrant community. Throughout the semester, Daniel threw himself into his studies, attending lectures by renowned professors and participating in lively discussions with his peers. He was particularly drawn to the work of Dr. Maria Rodriguez, a trailblazing mathematician who was pushing the boundaries of number theory. As the weeks flew by, Daniel found himself growing more confident in his abilities. He began to see the world in a new light, recognizing the intricate patterns and structures that underpinned the universe. His passion for mathematics was ignited, and he knew that he was exactly where he was meant to be. The year 2026 was shaping up to be a transformative one for Daniel Visscher. As he delved deeper into the world of mathematics, he was poised to make his mark on the future.
